Hi Ken(L),

2009/12/15 Ken Lloyd <kalloyd@...>
>
> BTW, the reason I asked has more to do with backprop through MLFF networks (which if they have recurrent paths may not be
> FF nets at all, in the view of some).

Not /quite/ sure what you're getting at here. Surely if there are
recurrent paths then the network is no longer FF? Anyway I think the
scheme I'm proposing (and variations on it) allows for fast evolution
of networks of with various kinds of restrictions. By FF I mean DAGs,
but I think the idea could be applied to evolve trees and potentially
other types of structure.

The main motivation for me is that although extra work is required in
the mutation and crossover schemes, the resulting networks can be
efficiently computed. If all you wanted was an FF network then
evolving cyclic/recurrent networks as I do currently is very wasteful.
Other times you genuinely want strictly FF-only, e.g. I suspect HMMs
fall into that category, though I may be wrong on that one.

Colin
